payload.title: APM2 Security Documentation
payload.directory_purpose: This directory contains security guidelines and operational procedures for APM2.

security_philosophy.name: Fail-closed
security_philosophy.statement: When in doubt, deny access or abort operations.

security_philosophy.name: Minimal secrets
security_philosophy.statement: Use keyless signing to eliminate long-lived signing key custody.

payload.runtime_semantics_boundary: Protocol and runtime trust semantics are defined by RFC-0020; this directory translates those semantics into operational procedures.

documents.purpose: Security modes, invariants, and enforcement posture.
Keyless release signing and verification procedures.
High-assurance release workflow and required gates.
Credential custody, distribution, redaction, and leak response controls.
Incident severity model, playbooks, and closure criteria.
Threat classes, adversary assumptions, and required controls.
Network-focused threat matrix and control bindings.
Operational pre-merge and release security verification checklist.
Consensus-layer incident, diagnostics, and recovery runbook.

keyless_signing_insight.summary: Cosign keyless signing removes long-lived signing-key storage from release operations.
keyless_flow: GitHub Actions obtains OIDC identity token.
Artifact is signed with ephemeral key.
Signing event is logged in Rekor transparency log.
keyless_signing_insight.outcome: No long-lived signing keys to store, rotate, or protect.
keyless_signing_insight.scope_note: Keyless signing secures release artifacts only; runtime inter-holon authority uses RFC-0020 identity and receipt authentication semantics.

indexing_notes: RFC-0020 requirement coverage is maintained in SECURITY_POLICY and SECURITY_CHECKLIST artifacts via inline requirement evidence references and gap notes.
References should point to structured CAC documents for deterministic retrieval and enforcement.
Security documentation index must remain machine-readable for large-scale automation and policy checking.

cryptography_posture.pqc_note: PQC migration is deferred in current security-document indexing and release-signing guidance.
